meanings.definition: Lacking initiative or strength of character; irresponsible.
meanings.sent1: The feckless student never bothered to complete his homework.
meanings.sent2: She was often described as feckless due to her careless attitude towards work.
meanings.sent3: The feckless puppy kept running away from its owner, causing chaos in the park.
meanings.sent4: His feckless behavior at the office led to constant reprimands from his boss.
meanings.sent5: The image of the feckless man lounging on the couch all day stuck in her mind.

meanings.sent1: The feckless attempts to fix the leak only made the situation worse.
meanings.sent2: The feckless leader's decisions resulted in chaos within the organization.
meanings.sent3: Despite his feckless efforts, he couldn't seem to bake a simple cake.
meanings.sent4: Her feckless driving skills made her a danger on the road.
meanings.sent5: The feckless gardener's neglect caused the plants to wither and die.
